intro: Bartsia kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy areas at elevations above 2,500 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
